Short Description: Informational meeting on Homeownership Assistance Fund
Details:
Partners and Stakeholders,
 
I am pleased to share that we are hosting an informational meeting on the Homeowner Assistance Fund (HAF) on Thursday, July 1st at 11am. During this call, staff will be available to provide updates on the HAF planning and programming process and receive additional input.
 
To Register for the Zoom Meeting:
https://us02web.zoom.us/meeting/register/tZIkdOuorT0jHtCT7QQMNwkbb8OYhEfjQwOm 
 
Through HAF, Oregon will receive about $90 million to assist homeowners whose pandemic-related financial hardships have caused or increased a risk of mortgage delinquency or foreclosure, displacement, or loss of utilities, energy, or broadband services. Treasury requires OHCS to complete planning and engagement to evaluate the needs of Oregon homeowners. OHCS has listened to its housing partners and several committees and is excited to provide an update on the development of Oregon’s HAF mortgage assistance program.
 
At this meeting OHCS will provide an update on: OHCS’ plans for its initial $9 million in HAF funding; the HAF planning process to date; and the broad strokes of the mortgage reinstatement and assistance program design. In addition to an opportunity for discussion on those points, or to provide written feedback, OHCS hopes to collect feedback on lessons learned from the design and administration of the Hardest Hit Fund programs.
 
We hope you can attend this informational meeting.
 
With Appreciation,

Emese Perfecto, Director of Homeownership
Emese.perfecto@oregon.gov
Oregon Housing and Community Services

Meeting Location: Treasury Tigard Office, 16290 SW Upper Boone’s Ferry Road
Treasury Tigard Office, 16290 SW Upper Boones Ferry Road

Short Description: Joint meeting with Oregon Investment Council
Meeting Location: Oregon State Treasury, 16290 SW Upper Boones Ferry Road
Details: PERS Board will be joining the second half of the regular OIC Board meeting 9:00am-1:00pm.

The public hearing will be jointly administered by the Department of State Lands (DSL) and the Oregon State Treasury (OST). Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the hearing will be conducted via Cisco Webex. You may provide written or oral testimony, or both. The State Treasurer and the Department of State Lands will review and consider all testimony and public comments.

Meeting Title: Heading Off a Retirement Reckoning in Oregon:  An Aspen Institute Forum on the Oregon Retirement Savings Program
Meeting Location: The University of Oregon in Portland - White Stag Block, 70 NW Couch Street
Details:
Featuring:

The Honorable Kate Brown
Governor of the State of Oregon

The Honorable Ted Wheeler
Treasurer of the State of Oregon

The Honorable J. Mark Iwry
Senior Advisor to the U.S. Secretary of the Treasury

Will Sandbrook
Strategy Director, United Kingdom's National Employment Savings Trust (NEST)

Followed by two distinguished panels, including:

Anthony Bunnell
Chief Product Officer, Honest Dollar

Barbara March
CEO, BridgePoint Group

Judy Miller
Director of Retirement Policy, American Retirement Association

Lew Minsky
President and CEO, Defined Contribution Institutional Investment Association (DCIIA)

Tom Simpson
Director of Government & Regulatory Affairs, Standard Insurance Company
